# Interacting with your app in the iOS and iPadOS simulator

**Article**

Use your Mac to control interactions with your iOS and iPadOS apps in Simulator.

## Overview

Simulator offers an environment to run apps in iOS or iPadOS without installing them on a physical device. When running your app in Simulator, use your Mac to navigate the app’s interface.

### Interact with your interface

Use your Mac’s pointer, keyboard, and menu items to make gestures on a simulated iOS or iPadOS device.



### Interact with hardware controls

Activate device buttons using menu items or by clicking on parts of the simulator bezel.



## Simulator interactions

- **Interacting with your app in the tvOS simulator**: Use your Mac to control interactions with your tvOS apps in Simulator.
- **Interacting with your app in the watchOS simulator**: Use your Mac to control interactions with your watchOS apps in Simulator.
- **Interacting with your app in the visionOS simulator**: Use your Mac to navigate spaces and control interactions with your visionOS apps in Simulator.
- **Configuring Simulator for your working environment**: Adjust Simulator settings for window or screen size, the light or dark appearance, and audio settings, and restart or reset a simulated device.
- **Simulating an external display or CarPlay**: Test how your app handles an external display or CarPlay from Simulator.
- **Capturing screenshots and videos from Simulator**: Record and share test results, or prepare for App Store distribution with screenshots and videos of your app from Simulator.
